children.title: Is this inspection for a hospital?

options.text: Hoistway Door for Elevator and Dumbwaiter

children.title: Access Door Visual inspection (5.2.3.5)
children.hint: 5.2.3.5 Swinging Doors with Builders Hardware or Fire Door Hardware. 5.2.3.5.1 Fire door assemblies shall be visually inspected from both sides to assess the overall condition of door assembly. 5.2.3.5.2 As a minimum, the following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of either the door or frame. (3) Glazing, vision light frames, and glazing beads are intact and securely fastened in place, if so equipped. (4) The door, frame, hinges, hardware, and noncombustible threshold are secured, aligned, and in working order with no visible signs of damage. (5) No parts are missing or broken. (6) Door clearances do not exceed clearances listed in 4.8.4 and 6.3.1.7. (7) The self-closing device is operational; that is, the active door completely closes when operated from the full open position. (8) If a coordinator is installed, the inactive leaf closes before the active leaf. (9) Latching hardware operates and secures the door when it is in the closed position. (10) Auxiliary hardware items that interfere or prohibit operation are not installed on the door or frame. (11)* No field modifications to the door assembly have been performed that void the label. (12) Meeting edge protection, gasketing and edge seals, where required, are inspected to verify their presence and integrity. (13) Signage affixed to a door meets the requirements listed in 4.1.4.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Access Door Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Double Swing Door Visual inspection (5.2.3.5.2)
children.hint: 5.2.3.5.2 As a minimum, the following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of either the door or frame. (3) Glazing, vision light frames, and glazing beads are intact and securely fastened in place, if so equipped. (7) The self-closing device is operational; that is, the active door completely closes when operated from the full open position. (8) If a coordinator is installed, the inactive leaf closes before the active leaf. (9) Latching hardware operates and secures the door when it is in the closed position. (10) Auxiliary hardware items that interfere or prohibit operation are not installed on the door or frame. (11)* No field modifications to the door assembly have been performed that void the label. (12) Meeting edge protection, gasketing and edge seals, where required, are inspected to verify their presence and integrity. (13) Signage affixed to a door meets the requirements listed in 4.1.4.

Double Swing Door Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

Exterior Door Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fire Shutter Visual inspection (5.2.4)
children.hint: 5.2.4 Periodic Inspection and Testing. 5.2.4.1* Periodic inspections and testing shall be performed not less than annually. 5.2.4.2 As a minimum, the provisions of 5.2.3 shall be included in the periodic inspection and testing procedure.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fire Shutter Operational test (5.2.3.7.1)
children.hint: 5.2.3.7.1 All fire doors, fire shutters, and fire window assemblies shall be inspected and tested to check for proper operation and full closure.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fire Window Visual Inspection (5.2.4)
children.hint: 5.2.4 Periodic Inspection and Testing. 5.2.4.1* Periodic inspections and testing shall be performed not less than annually. 5.2.4.2 As a minimum, the provisions of 5.2.3 shall be included in the periodic inspection and testing procedure.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fire Window Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Horizontal Accordion Visual inspection (5.2.3.5)
children.hint: 5.2.3.5 Swinging Doors with Builders Hardware or Fire Door Hardware. 5.2.3.5.1 Fire door assemblies shall be visually inspected from both sides to assess the overall condition of door assembly. 5.2.3.5.2 As a minimum, the following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of either the door or frame. (3) Glazing, vision light frames, and glazing beads are intact and securely fastened in place, if so equipped. (4) The door, frame, hinges, hardware, and noncombustible threshold are secured, aligned, and in working order with no visible signs of damage. (5) No parts are missing or broken. (6) Door clearances do not exceed clearances listed in 4.8.4 and 6.3.1.7. (7) The self-closing device is operational; that is, the active door completely closes when operated from the full open position. (8) If a coordinator is installed, the inactive leaf closes before the active leaf. (9) Latching hardware operates and secures the door when it is in the closed position. (10) Auxiliary hardware items that interfere or prohibit operation are not installed on the door or frame. (11)* No field modifications to the door assembly have been performed that void the label. children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Horizontal Accordion Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Horizontally Sliding Door Visual inspection (5.2.3.6.2)
children.hint: 5.2.3.6.2 At a minimum, the following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of either the door or the frame. (3) Slats, endlocks, bottom bar, guide assembly, curtain entry, hood, and flame baffle are correctly installed and intact for rolling steel fire doors. (4) Glazing, vision light frames, and glazing beads are intact and securely fastened in place, if so equipped. (6) Expansion clearance is maintained in accordance with the manufacturer’s listing. (7) Drop release arms and weights are not blocked or wedged. (8) Mounting and assembly bolts are intact and secured. (9) Attachments to jambs are with bolts, expansion anchors, or as otherwise required by the listing. (10) Smoke detectors, if equipped, are installed and operational. (11) No parts are missing or broken. (12)* Fusible links, if equipped, are in the correct location; chain/ cable, s-hooks, eyes, and so forth, are in good condition; the cable or chain is not kinked, pinched, twisted, or inflexible; and links are not painted or coated with dust or grease. (13) Auxiliary hardware items that interfere or prohibit operation are not installed on the door or frame. (14) No field modifications to the door assembly have been performed that void the label. (15) Doors have an average closing speed of not less than 6 in./sec (152 mm/sec) or more than 24 in./sec (610 mm/sec).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Horizontally Sliding Door Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Rolling Steel Door Visual inspection (5.2.3.6.2)
children.hint: 5.2.3.6.2 At a minimum, the following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of either the door or the frame. (3) Slats, endlocks, bottom bar, guide assembly, curtain entry, hood, and flame baffle are correctly installed and intact for rolling steel fire doors. (4) Glazing, vision light frames, and glazing beads are intact and securely fastened in place, if so equipped. (5) Curtain, barrel, and guides are aligned, level, plumb, and true for rolling steel fire doors. (6) Expansion clearance is maintained in accordance with the manufacturer’s listing. (7) Drop release arms and weights are not blocked or wedged. (8) Mounting and assembly bolts are intact and secured. (9) Attachments to jambs are with bolts, expansion anchors, or as otherwise required by the listing. (10) Smoke detectors, if equipped, are installed and operational. (11) No parts are missing or broken. (12)* Fusible links, if equipped, are in the correct location; chain/ cable, s-hooks, eyes, and so forth, are in good condition; the cable or chain is not kinked, pinched, twisted, or inflexible; and links are not painted or coated with dust or grease. (13) Auxiliary hardware items that interfere or prohibit operation are not installed on the door or frame. (14) No field modifications to the door assembly have been performed that void the label. (15) Doors have an average closing speed of not less than 6 in./sec (152 mm/sec) or more than 24 in./sec (610 mm/sec).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Rolling Steel Door First drop test (5.2.3.7.3.2)
children.hint: 5.2.3.7.3.2 The first test shall be to check for proper operation and full closure.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Rolling Steel Door Second drop test (5.2.3.7.3.3)
children.hint: 5.2.3.7.3.3 A second test shall be done to verify that the automatic-closing device has been reset correctly.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Single Fire Rated Door Visual inspection (5.2.3.6.2)
children.hint: 5.2.3.6.2 At a minimum, the following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of either the door or the frame. (3) Slats, endlocks, bottom bar, guide assembly, curtain entry, hood, and flame baffle are correctly installed and intact for rolling steel fire doors. (4) Glazing, vision light frames, and glazing beads are intact and securely fastened in place, if so equipped. (6) Expansion clearance is maintained in accordance with the manufacturer’s listing. (7) Drop release arms and weights are not blocked or wedged. (8) Mounting and assembly bolts are intact and secured. (9) Attachments to jambs are with bolts, expansion anchors, or as otherwise required by the listing. (10) Smoke detectors, if equipped, are installed and operational. (11) No parts are missing or broken. (12)* Fusible links, if equipped, are in the correct location; chain/ cable, s-hooks, eyes, and so forth, are in good condition; the cable or chain is not kinked, pinched, twisted, or inflexible; and links are not painted or coated with dust or grease. (13) Auxiliary hardware items that interfere or prohibit operation are not installed on the door or frame. (14) No field modifications to the door assembly have been performed that void the label. (15) Doors have an average closing speed of not less than 6 in./sec (152 mm/sec) or more than 24 in./sec (610 mm/sec).

Single Fire Rated Door Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Vertically Sliding Door Visual inspection (5.2.3.6.2)
children.hint: 5.2.3.6.2 At a minimum, the following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of either the door or the frame. (3) Slats, endlocks, bottom bar, guide assembly, curtain entry, hood, and flame baffle are correctly installed and intact for rolling steel fire doors. (4) Glazing, vision light frames, and glazing beads are intact and securely fastened in place, if so equipped. (6) Expansion clearance is maintained in accordance with the manufacturer’s listing. (7) Drop release arms and weights are not blocked or wedged. (8) Mounting and assembly bolts are intact and secured. (9) Attachments to jambs are with bolts, expansion anchors, or as otherwise required by the listing. (10) Smoke detectors, if equipped, are installed and operational. (11) No parts are missing or broken. (12)* Fusible links, if equipped, are in the correct location; chain/ cable, s-hooks, eyes, and so forth, are in good condition; the cable or chain is not kinked, pinched, twisted, or inflexible; and links are not painted or coated with dust or grease. Vertically Sliding Door Operational test (5.2.4.3)
children.hint: 5.2.4.3 Inspection shall include an operational test for automatic-closing doors and windows to verify that the assembly will close under fire conditions.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Full and unobstructed access to damper and all listed components. (19.3.2.4) - Ceiling Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.4 The operational test shall verify that there is full and unobstructed access to the dynamic combination fire/smoke damper and all listed components.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper fully close from open position when activated. (19.3.1.1) - Ceiling Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.1 The damper shall fully close from the open position.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper operation is unobstructed (19.3.1.4) - Ceiling Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.4 The operational test shall verify that there are no obstructions to the operation of the damper.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Indicating devices operate properly, and report to intended locations. (19.3.2.5) - Ceiling Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.5 All indicating devices shall be verified to work and report to the intended location.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible link operation temperature correct for this application. (19.3.1.7) - Ceiling Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.7 The fusible link operating temperature shall be in accordance with NFPA 90A and ANSI/UL 33, Standard for Heat Responsive Links for Fire-Protection Services, temperature classifications and ratings.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible link without damage, paint, has correct load rating, and not expired. (19.5.2.2.7) - Ceiling Damper
children.hint: 19.5.2.2.7 If the link appears damaged, it shall be replaced with a functionally equivalent listed link.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Full and unobstructed access to damper and all listed components. (19.3.2.4) - Fire/Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.4 The operational test shall verify that there is full and unobstructed access to the dynamic combination fire/smoke damper and all listed components.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper fully close from open position when activated (19.3.1.1) - Fire/Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.1 The damper shall fully close from the open position.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper operation is unobstructed (19.3.2.3) - Fire/Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.3 The operational test shall verify that there are no obstructions to the operation of the dynamic combination fire/ smoke damper.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Indicating devices operate properly, and report to intended locations. (19.3.2.5) - Fire/Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.5 All indicating devices shall be verified to work and report to the intended location.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible link operation temperature correct for this application. (19.3.1.7) - Fire/Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.7 The fusible link operating temperature shall be in accordance with NFPA 90A and ANSI/UL 33, Standard for Heat Responsive Links for Fire-Protection Services, temperature classifications and ratings.

Fusible link without damage, paint, has correct load rating, and not expired? (19.5.2.2.7) - Fire/Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.5.2.2.7 If the link appears damaged, it shall be replaced with a functionally equivalent listed link.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Full and unobstructed access to damper and all listed components. (19.3.2.4) - Dynamic Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.4 The operational test shall verify that there is full and unobstructed access to the dynamic combination fire/smoke damper and all listed components.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper fully close from open position when activated (19.3.1.1) - Dynamic Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.1 The damper shall fully close from the open position.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper operation is unobstructed (19.3.1.4) - Dynamic Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.4 The operational test shall verify that there are no obstructions to the operation of the damper.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Indicating devices operate properly, and report to intended locations. (19.3.2.5) - Dynamic Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.5 All indicating devices shall be verified to work and report to the intended location.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible link operation temperature correct for this application. (19.3.1.7) - Dynamic Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.7 The fusible link operating temperature shall be in accordance with NFPA 90A and ANSI/UL 33, Standard for Heat Responsive Links for Fire-Protection Services, temperature classifications and ratings.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible link without damage, paint, has correct load rating, and not expired? (19.5.2.2.7) - Dynamic Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.5.2.2.7 If the link appears damaged, it shall be replaced with a functionally equivalent listed link.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
System airflow at damper within the velocity rating of damper listing? (19.3.1.3) - Dynamic Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.3 For dynamic dampers, it shall be verified that the system airflow where the damper is installed is within the velocity rating of the damper listing

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Full and unobstructed access to damper and all listed components. (19.3.1.5) - Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.5 The operational test shall verify that there is full and unobstructed access to the fire damper and all listed components.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper fully close from open position when activated (19.3.1.1) - Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.1 The damper shall fully close from the open position.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper operation is unobstructed (19.3.1.4) - Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.4 The operational test shall verify that there are no obstructions to the operation of the damper.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Indicating devices operate properly, and report to intended locations. (19.3.2.5) - Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.5 All indicating devices shall be verified to work and report to the intended location.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible link operation temperature correct for this application. (19.3.1.7) - Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.7 The fusible link operating temperature shall be in accordance with NFPA 90A and ANSI/UL 33, Standard for Heat Responsive Links for Fire-Protection Services, temperature classifications and ratings.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible link without damage, paint, has correct load rating, and not expired? (19.5.2.2.7) - Fire Damper
children.hint: 19.5.2.2.7 If the link appears damaged, it shall be replaced with a functionally equivalent listed link.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Full and unobstructed access to damper and all listed components. (19.4.2) - Damper w/Actuator
children.hint: 19.4.2 Before testing, a visual inspection shall be performed to identify any damaged or missing parts that can create a hazard during testing or affect operation or resetting.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper fully close from open position when activated (19.4.3.1, 19.4.3.2) - Damper w/Actuator
children.hint: 19.4.3.1 Acceptance testing of dampers designed to close via an electric or pneumatic acturator shall be conducted by removing electrical power or air pressure from the actuator and ensuring that the damper closes properly. 19.4.3.2 Electrical power or air pressure shall then be reapplied to the damper to confirm that it returns to its full-open position.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper operation is unobstructed (19.3.1.4) - Damper w/Actuator
children.hint: 19.3.1.4 The operational test shall verify that there are no obstructions to the operation of the damper.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Full and unobstructed access to damper and all listed components. (19.3.1.5) - Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.5 The operational test shall verify that there is full and unobstructed access to the fire damper and all listed components.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper fully close from open position when activated (19.3.1.1) - Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.1 The damper shall fully close from the open position.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Damper operation is unobstructed (19.3.1.4) - Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.1.4 The operational test shall verify that there are no obstructions to the operation of the damper.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Indicating devices operate properly, and report to intended locations. (19.3.2.5) - Smoke Damper
children.hint: 19.3.2.5 All indicating devices shall be verified to work and report to the intended location.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Controls are unobstructed and accessible. (20.6.10.2) - Curtain
children.hint: 20.6.10.2 Controls shall be unobstructed at all times.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Function labels and signage In place and properly mounted (20.6.10.4, 20.6.10.6, 20.7.3.5) - Curtain
children.hint: 20.6.10.4 Function labels shall be permanent and located on the buttons or on the control station adjacent to the buttons. 20.6.10.6* A sign shall be mounted adjacent to each fire safety curtain control station stating the following: NONEMERGENCY FIRE SAFETY CURTAIN OPERATION ONLY 20.7.3.5 Signage specific to the action necessary to activate the manual emergency closing device shall be located within 2 ft (0.61 m) of each manual emergency closing device.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Nonemergency operation performed with constant pressure by one person. Or a continuous sensing device is provided and operating properly. (20.7.2.1, 20.7.2.2.7, 20.7.2.2.1) - Curtain
children.hint: 20.7.2.1 Nonemergency operation of the fire safety curtain assembly shall be accomplished by one person. 20.7.2.2 For nonemergency operation, controls shall require constant pressure to close the fire safety curtain. 20.7.2.2.1 As an alternative, the fire safety curtain shall be provided with a continuous sensing device attached to the bottom of the curtain to stop or reverse the curtain upon contact with an obstruction.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fire curtain activation by manual and rate-of-rise heat detection. (20.7.3.1) - Curtain
children.hint: 20.7.3.1 The fire safety curtain assembly shall be activated by manual emergency operation and rate-of-rise heat detection located above the stage.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fire control line damage free. (20.7.3.4.1) - Curtain
children.hint: 20.7.3.4.1 Operations requiring cutting or severing a line shall not be permitted.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Quick release mechanism for manual closing is in place and operating properly. (20.7.3.4) - Curtain
children.hint: 20.7.3.4 Manual emergency closing of the curtain shall be accomplished by a quick-release mechanism. There shall be at least two manual release mechanisms located on the stage side of the proscenium wall, one right of the proscenium opening and one left of the proscenium opening.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Owner and staff retrained. (20.9.1.3) - Curtain
children.hint: 20.9.1.3 Retraining of the owner and staff shall be mandatory during each annual inspection.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Visual Inspection (21.7.2, 21.7.5) - Curtain Assembly
children.hint: 21.7.2 Before testing, a visual inspection shall be performed to identify any damaged or missing parts that can create a hazard during testing or affect operation or resetting. 21.7.5 The following items shall be verified: (1) Labels are clearly visible and legible. (2) No open holes or breaks exist in surfaces of the curtain or in the stitching of the curtain. (3) Curtain, guides, and coil are aligned, level, plumb, and true. (4) Mounting and assembly bolts are intact and secured. (5) Attachments to jambs are with bolts, expansion anchors, or as otherwise required by the listing. (6) Smoke detectors, if equipped, are installed, operational, and in accordance with NFPA 72. (7) No parts are missing or broken. (8) Auxiliary hardware items that interfere or prohibit operation are not installed on the curtain or frame. (9) No field modifications to the fire protective curtain assembly have been performed that void the label….

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Fusible links, release devices and other moveable parts paint, coating and interference free. (21.7.7) - Curtain Assembly
children.hint: 21.7.7 Fusible links, release devices, and other moveable parts shall not be painted or coated with other materials that could interfere with the operation of the assembly.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Operational test (21.7.3, 21.7.5) - Curtain Assembly
children.hint: 21.7.3 Acceptance testing shall include the closing of the fire protective curtain assembly by all means of activation. 21.7.5 The following items shall be verified: … (10) Fire protective curtain assemblies have an average closing speed of not less than 6 in./sec (152 mm/sec) or more than 24 in./sec (610 mm/sec).

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
First drop test (21.7.6, 21.7.6.1) - Curtain Assembly
children.hint: 21.7.6 Fire protective curtain assemblies shall be drop-tested twice. 21.7.6.1 The first test shall be to check for proper operation and full closure.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Second drop test (21.7.6, 21.7.6.2) - Curtain Assembly
children.hint: 21.7.6 Fire protective curtain assemblies shall be drop-tested twice. 21.7.6.2 A second test shall be done to verify that the automatic-closing device has been reset correctly.

children.title: Take a picture of the issue
Liability Release Statement
children.calculate_expr: "The owner and/or designated representative acknowledges the responsibility of the operating condition of the component parts at the time of this inspection. It is agreed that the inspection service provided by the contractor as prescribed herein is limited to performing a visual inspection and/or routine testing, and any investigation or unscheduled testing, modification, maintenance, repair, etc., of the component parts is not included as part of the inspection work performed. It is further understood that all information contained herein is provided to the best of the knowledge of the party providing such information."
